greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of prime factors (counted with multiplicity) of d(n), the number of divisors of n.
comment: a(n) = 1 iff n = p^(q-1) with p, q primes (A009087).

a(n) = 2 if n=p*q with p, q primes (A006881), or if n=p^2*q with p, q primes (A054753), or if n=p^4*q with p, q primes (A178739), or if n=p^6*q with p, q primes (A189987), or if n=p^2*q^4 with p, q primes (A189988), or if n=p^(m-1) with p prime and m is semiprime in A001358 (not exhaustive). (End)
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[PrimeOmega@ DivisorSigma[0, n], {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 18 2017 *)
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Nov 23 2000
